thread.title: Public health chiefs' warning over Brac dump fire
thread.title_full: Public health chiefs' warning over Brac dump fire

author: Raymond Hainey
title: Public health chiefs' warning over Brac dump fire
text:
A health warning about smoke from a fire at a landfill site has been issued for Cayman Brac.
Environmental health officials said people downwind of the dump should keep doors and windows closed and limit outside activity in areas where smoke persisted.
The caution came after smoke and flames were spotted at the landfill site on Tuesday afternoon.
Firefighters fought the blaze into Wednesday to bring it under control.
But an environmental health spokesman said, “There remains smoke generating from the site, but this is reducing.
“The department of environmental health is working to place cover materials over the area to reduce this impact further.”
The landfill was closed on Wednesday as the covering work and damping down of the fire site continued.
Officials said the cause of the blaze was unknown, but it is thought that recently deposited trash ignited and caused the fire.
Contact the environmental health department on 949 6696, by email at dehcustomerservice@gov.ky or visit its website here or message its Facebook page here for further information.
